subject: Principal Product Manager - AWS New Initiative (Seattle or Boston), AWS New Initiative
job_desc:
About the job
Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

Are you looking for an opportunity to create a new, global product from scratch? Are you excited by the idea of using data analytics and artificial intelligence to reinvent complex sales and marketing processes? AWS is seeking innovative, passionate, results-oriented leader to drive product management for an exciting new global product. This is a confidential strategic initiative for AWS.

We are looking for an experienced product manager that thrives by creating high-bar product and engineering cultures. You will be a member of a team working on a game changing AWS offering that intersects highly scalable real-time software, front-end technologies, innovative user experience, machine learning, and data analytics.

This position may be based in our Boston, MA; or our Seattle, WA AWS office.

Key job responsibilities

You will be responsible for driving the technical product roadmap, and partnering with development, UX, and customer success teams to deliver new products. In this position, you’ll be an owner in innovating and delivering disruptive value to our customers, expanding customer adoption and usage growth, and raising the bar in ensuring we deliver the best possible customer experience.

A day in the life

We’re looking for a tenacious self-starter with a passion for sales and marketing engagement products, who can serve as a strong advocate for our customers. You should have excellent analytical capabilities, strong writing skills, ability to technically dive deep and work independently with development teams, and the desire to develop ideas independently and thrive in a fast-paced start-up environment. You must have a track record of understanding customer needs and delivering technology solutions to address those needs.



Come join a smart, innovative team that’s obsessed with serving its customers and is having fun doing so in a start-up-like environment!

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.






Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.


- Amazon Web Services, Inc.

Job ID: A1807811

subject: Senior Product Manager - Data Platform
job_desc:
About the job
Sophos is a worldwide leader in next-generation cybersecurity, protecting more than 500,000 organizations and millions of consumers in more than 150 countries from today’s most advanced cyberthreats. Powered by threat intelligence, AI and machine learning from SophosLabs and SophosAI, Sophos delivers a broad portfolio of advanced products and services to secure users, networks and endpoints against ransomware, malware, exploits, phishing and the wide range of other cyberattacks. Sophos provides a single integrated cloud-based management console, Sophos Central – the centerpiece of an adaptive cybersecurity ecosystem that features a centralized data lake that leverages a rich set of open APIs available to customers, partners, developers, and other cybersecurity vendors. Sophos sells its products and services through reseller partners and managed service providers (MSPs) worldwide. Sophos has major hubs around the globe. More information is available at www.sophos.com

subject: Sr Product Mktg Manager - GTM, Blink
job_desc:
About the job
Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

Blink is at the forefront of the consumer electronics home security market, and is the result of one of the most successful Kickstarter campaigns ever. We have been growing at an astounding rate since the first product introduction in 2016. We are seeking a creative, customer-obsessed and results-driven go-to-market (GTM) professional to lead our GTM team and help bring new products to market globally.

The Blink go-to-market team is small, but mighty. We strike a balance between start-up nimbleness with a bias for action, and scaled, customer-obsessed, data-driven decision making. We are a passionate group, collaborative in nature, and firm believers in hard work and teamwork. We are responsible for bringing to market all areas of the roadmap, spanning devices, new features, new regions, and more.

Key job responsibilities

A day in the life

As the Senior Product Marketing Manager, you will leverage your interpersonal and organizational skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams across Blink and Amazon (sales, marketing, engineering, program management, operations, legal) to launch innovative products for our customers across the globe. You will collect and analyze consumer, product and market segment data to inform product and feature positioning strategy. You will manage the go-to-market team, and drive planning and strategy across all Blink device and feature programs – coordinating with public relation and sales to deliver recommendations that optimize for customer and business success.






Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.


- Amazon.com Services LLC

Job ID: A1602359

subject: Principal Product Manager, Cloud-Native Platform
job_desc:
About the job
Job Description:

Principal Product Manager, Cloud-Native Platform

The Global Platform team at DataRobot is responsible for building the architectural and foundational capabilities for easier services integration, deployment and operations of DataRobot AI platform in a heterogeneous infrastructure landscape. This includes almost everything we do around infrastructure (compute, storage, networking), private/public/hybrid cloud deployment experience, resource management, reliability, observability, security and administration.

As a senior member of the Platform Product Management team at DataRobot, you will lead the delivery of a high-performance, innovative, multi-cloud AI platform infrastructure roadmap, bringing together the latest advances in software (such as Kubernetes and the associated ecosystem) and cloud integrations across AWS, Azure, GCP and more. You will influence the product vision and strategy around our cloud-based offerings (for SaaS and VPC customers), our journey towards a better cloud-native architecture and execute cross-functionally to address the myriad needs of internal engineering teams and external customers.

Core Responsibilities







All U.S. DataRobot employees must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. If there is a medical, religious, or other legally protected reason that prevents you from receiving an available COVID-19 vaccination, and you are selected as a candidate for consideration, we have a process in place to evaluate requests for accommodation.

DataRobot is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. DataRobot is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and mental disabilities. Please see the United States Department of Labor’s EEO poster and EEO poster supplement for additional information.

All applicant data submitted is handled in accordance with our Applicant Privacy Policy.

subject: Senior Director, Product
job_desc:
About the job
The Product team at Klaviyo is continuously looking for ways to build and deliver the best product possible for our customers. We’re looking for a Senior Director of Product to join our rapidly growing team with expertise in solving problems with a customer-first mindset and bringing new products to market. You will develop a team of Group Product Managers as you work cross-functionally to guide product development from concept to launch.





At Klaviyo we value the unique backgrounds, experiences and perspectives each Klaviyo (we call ourselves Klaviyos) brings to our workplace each and every day. We believe everyone deserves a fair shot at success and appreciate the experiences each person brings beyond the traditional job requirements. If you’re a close but not exact match with the description, we hope you’ll still consider applying.



Klaviyo is a world-leading marketing automation platform dedicated to accelerating revenue and customer connection for online businesses. Klaviyo makes it easy to store, access, analyze and use transactional and behavioral data to power highly-targeted customer and prospect communications. The company's hybrid customer-data and marketing-platform model allows companies to grow by fostering direct relationships with customers, without giving up their valuable data to popular big-tech ad platforms. Over 265,000 innovative companies like Unilever, Custom Ink, Living Proof and Huckberry sell more with Klaviyo. Learn more at .

subject: Senior Product Manager
job_desc:
About the job
Security Performance Management (SPM) is all about helping customers do jobs related to cybersecurity governance, management, and assurance. If you are successful in your role, you will have helped security leaders monitor, manage and communicate cybersecurity performance to stakeholders within and outside their organizations. As a result of your efforts, you will help BitSight create a universal understanding of cybersecurity risk and measurably reduce cyber risk around the world.

subject: Sr. Data Product Manager
job_desc:
About the job
About CyberArk:
CyberArk (NASDAQ: CYBR) is the global leader in Identity Security. Centered on privileged access management, CyberArk provides the most comprehensive security offering for any identity – human or machine – across business applications, distributed workforces, hybrid cloud workloads and throughout the DevOps lifecycle. The world’s leading organizations trust CyberArk to help secure their most critical assets. To learn more about CyberArk, visit https://www.cyberark.com, read the CyberArk blogs or follow on Twitter via @CyberArk, LinkedIn or Facebook.
